roleset.name: directed motion, be ahead of
roleset.note: LEAD-V NOTES: Member of Vncls accompany-51.7. (from lead.01-v)
LEAD-N NOTES: Member of Vncls accompany-51.7. (from lead.01-n)

example.name: lead-v: cause to go
example.text: John led the unhappy group of travellers from the frying pan to the fire.

example.name: lead-v: be ranked higher than
example.text: California led the nation with $6.5 billion in net cash income last year.
example.arg: with $6.5 billion in net cash income

example.name: lead-n: autogen1
example.text: Compaq's six-month lead on the competition

example.name: lead-n: autogen2
example.text: a 33-point lead in the polls over Mr. Giuliani

roleset.name: act as project leader, be the leader
roleset.note: LEAD-V NOTES: Member of Vncls supervision-95.2.2. (from lead.02-v)
LEADERSHIP-N NOTES: Updated by Julia. (from leadership.01-n)
LEAD-N NOTES: Updated by Julia. (from lead.02-n)

roles.note: This is very rare as a nominalization. (from lead.02-n)

example.name: lead-v: group
example.text: Dr. Talcott led a team of researchers from the National Cancer Institute and the medical schools of Harvard University and Boston University.
example.arg: a team of researchers from the National Cancer Institute and the medical schools of Harvard University and Boston University

example.name: leadership-n: with MNR
example.text: responsible and bipartisan leadership

example.name: leadership-n: arg2 as proposition
example.text: his leadership in bringing peaceful and democratic change to Yugoslavia
example.arg: in bringing peaceful and democratic change to Yugoslovia

example.name: leadership-n: arg1
example.text: market leadership

example.name: leadership-n: another arg2 proposition
example.text: his leadership during his term in Congress in expanding family - planning services for the poor
example.arg: in expanding family - planning services for the poor

example.name: lead-n: very rare example
example.text: his lead of the company on tour in James's absence

roleset.name: cause a result
roleset.note: LEAD-V NOTES: Vn updated by Julia. Member of Vncls force-59.1 and result-27.2. (from lead.03-v)
LEAD-N NOTES: Updated by Julia. Member of Vncls force-59.1. (from lead.03-n)

roles.note: This is also rare as a nominalization. (from lead.03-n)

role.descr: result, action or attribute on arg1

example.name: lead-v: NP complement
example.text: It was just another one of the risk factors that-1 *trace*-1 led to the company's decision to withdraw from the bidding.
example.arg: that -> just another one of the risk factors
to the company's decision to withdraw from the bidding

example.name: lead-v: S complement
example.text: It does lead you to suspect imports are going down.
example.arg: to suspect imports are going down

example.name: lead-v: passive
example.text: John-1 was led *trace*-1 to believe that the moon was made of green cheese.
example.arg: to believe that the moon was made of green cheese

example.name: lead-n: arg0
example.text: The state of California , following the lead of some regionalparks , recently adopted regulations that closed nearly allhiking paths in state parks to mountain bicycles .

example.name: lead-n: with LOC
example.text: follow the US lead in the OAS

example.name: lead-n: subject matter of lead
example.text: A month later , U.S. and Pakistani force has a lead on Osama Bin Laden , but by the time they moved in , he had vanished again .

example.name: lead-n: args 0 and 2
example.text: ...Fidelity Investments and other large mutual - fund companies might soon follow the lead of Kemper Corp. and other institutions in cutting off trading business to securities firms that do program trading .
example.arg: of Kemper Corp. and other institutions
in cutting off trading business to securities firms that do program trading

roleset.name: begin
roleset.note: LEAD_OFF-V NOTES: This probably won't occur, but for other possible structures refer to "begin" (from lead.04-v)

example.name: lead_off-v: begin
example.text: John led off the party with a raunchy toast.

roleset.name: precede, spatially or temporally, terminating at a determined point
roleset.note: LEAD_UP-V NOTES: Roleset for 'lead up' based on instances in webtext 2.5 (500-599). No VerbNet entry. Framed by Claire (from lead.05-v)
LEAD_UP-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on lead-v.05: lead_up. No Vncls. (from lead.05-n)

example.name: lead_up-v
example.text: in March 2003 Jackson distraction - o - mania was part of the media smokescreen that-1 *T*-1 led up to the Iraq war ...

example.name: lead_up-v: with arg2
example.text: The Lead-Up to the 37th Annual Telluride Film Festival
example.arg: to the 37th Annual Telluride Film Festival

example.name: lead_up-v
example.text: The driveway leading up to my studio loft is 50 yards long .

example.name: lead_up-n: with arg1
example.text: his lead up to his current position

example.name: lead_up-n: another arg2
example.text: the lead up of the 2009 Depression
